sentences.en: " No, I wasn't behind you, I've been here for some tame.
sentences.cn: “ 不, 我没走在你的后面, 我来了好半天了.

sentences.en: A cat is a tame animal.
sentences.cn: 猫是一种温顺的动物.

sentences.en: But there was one tame when Mr. Hua got a great fright.
sentences.cn: 可是有一次,华威先生简直吃了一大惊.

sentences.en: He is so tame that he agrees with everybody.
sentences.cn: 他很随和,总是顺从他人的意见.

sentences.en: He tied them up and then horsewhipped them, to "tame" his catches before sending them off to zoos.
sentences.cn: 他将它们捆起来，然后用马鞭抽打，以“驯服”这些猎物，然后把它们送到动物园去。

sentences.en: His job is to tame lions.
sentences.cn: 他的工作是驯狮.

sentences.en: Horses are easy to tame.
sentences.cn: 马容易驯服.

sentences.en: I decided that teaching was too tame for me.
sentences.cn: 我最终认为教书对我来说太枯燥。

sentences.en: I have a tame doctor who'll always give me a sick note when I want a day off.
sentences.cn: 我的医生对我有求必应。我想要休一天假时，他总会给我开病假条。

sentences.en: If you have a tame doctor, he might give you a sick note.
sentences.cn: 要是你的医生好说话，他可能会给你开个病假条。

sentences.en: Most of the criticism has been pretty tame.
sentences.cn: 评论的大部分内容很乏味。

sentences.en: Tame birds, when approached, will stretch out their necks and ruffle their neck feathering.
sentences.cn: 驯养的鸟儿在有人靠近时会伸长脖子，竖起颈羽。

sentences.en: tame elephants
sentences.cn: 驯养的大象

sentences.en: The Amazons were believed to have been the first to tame horses.
sentences.cn: 据说亚马孙人最先驯化了马。

sentences.en: The film has a tame ending.
sentences.cn: 那电影的结局枯燥无味.

sentences.en: The party was tame because all the people were sleepy.
sentences.cn: 聚会很沉闷,因为大家昏昏欲睡.

sentences.en: The report was pretty tame stuff.
sentences.cn: 这份报告平淡无奇。

sentences.en: Two regiments of cavalry were called out to tame the crowds.
sentences.cn: 调集了两个装甲兵团去威慑、控制人群。

sentences.en: White rats tame easily.
sentences.cn: 白鼠易驯.

sentences.en: You'll find life here pretty tame after New York.
sentences.cn: 这里的生活相当枯燥，与纽约形成对比。

words.tran_cn: 驯服地，温顺地；没骨气地

trans.tran_en: a tame animal or bird is not wild any longer, because it has been trained to live with people
to reduce the power or strength of something and prevent it from causing trouble

trans.tran_cn: 制服， 控制并利用； 驯化， 驯服
trans.tran_en: to reduce the power or strength of something and prevent it from causing trouble
